english: the shape of a basket repeatedly woven from bamboo

etymology.description: 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") + 魚(魚) (yú, "fish") facing each other -> original script of 遘(遘) (gòu, "to meet") -> associated with encountering or meeting
etymology.interpretation: The character 冓(gòu) was originally intended to depict two fish facing each other, symbolizing an encounter or meeting. However, over time, its interpretation was altered, with a mistaken belief that it depicted accumulated woods.

examples.chinese: 他精心编织出了传统冓的篮子(他精心編織出了傳統冓的籃子)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīngxīn biānzhī chūle chuántǒng gòu de lánzi。
examples.english: He meticulously wove a basket in the traditional woven-basket shape (冓).

examples.chinese: 那细致的竹编工艺呈现冓美(那細致的竹編工藝呈現冓美)，蕴含深厚传统技艺(蘊含深厚傳統技藝)。
examples.pinyin: Nà xìzhì de zhúbiān gōngyì chéngxiàn gòu měi, yùnhán shēnhòu chuántǒng jìyì。
examples.english: The exquisite bamboo weaving displays the beauty of the woven-basket form (冓), embodying profound traditional craftsmanship.

examples.chinese: 匠人们以竹子打造冓型器物(匠人們以竹子打造冓型器物)。
examples.pinyin: Jiàngrénmen yǐ zhúzi dǎzào gòu xíng qìwù。
examples.english: Artisans use bamboo to create objects in the shape of a woven basket (冓).
